title: Probability
prompt: A church fundraiser lottery draws two winners from a pool numbered 1 through 50. Margery always puts her age, 34, on her lottery ticket. This month, the number 5 is drawn on the first draw, and removed from the pool. On the second draw, what is the probability of drawing the number 34?
hint: Probability is the ratio of the desired event, to the total possible events.
feedback:
The probability of drawing any particular number on the second draw is <math>
 <mrow>
<mfrac>
<mn>1</mn>
<mn>49</mn>
</mfrac>
</mrow>
</math>. When the first number is drawn, it is removed from the pool. When the number 5 is taken away, there are 49 numbers remaining: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and all the numbers up to 50. So, there are 49 possible outcomes of the draw. There is one desired outcome, the number 34. The probability of drawing the number 34 are 1 in 49, one desired outcome out of 49 possible outcomes.
